==Athletics==
==Athletics==
{{main|Washington State Cougars}}
{{main|Washington State Cougars}}
â
[[File:WashingtonStateCougars.png|Washington State Cougars Logo|thumb]]
 
Washington State University is a member of the [[Pacific-10 Conference]]. The school's mascot is "[[Butch T. Cougar]]" and the school's colors are crimson and gray. Varsity athletics include men's [[baseball]], [[basketball]], [[Cross country running|cross country]], [[American football|football]], [[golf]], and [[track and field]], as well as women's basketball, cross country, golf, [[Sport rowing|rowing]], [[soccer]], [[Swimming (sport)|swimming]], [[volleyball]], [[tennis]], and track and field. In the past WSU had varsity programs of [[boxing]], [[collegiate wrestling|wrestling]], [[gymnastics]], and men's [[Swimming (sport)|swimming]]. In 1917, WSU won its first National Championship in Men's Basketball. In 1937, Roy Petragallo and Ed McKinnon won the NCAA boxing championship, another national championship. The Cougars third and most recent National Championship was earned in 1977 Indoor Track and Field.
Washington State University is a member of the [[Pacific-10 Conference]]. The school's mascot is "[[Butch T. Cougar]]" and the school's colors are crimson and gray. Varsity athletics include men's [[baseball]], [[basketball]], [[Cross country running|cross country]], [[American football|football]], [[golf]], and [[track and field]], as well as women's basketball, cross country, golf, [[Sport rowing|rowing]], [[soccer]], [[Swimming (sport)|swimming]], [[volleyball]], [[tennis]], and track and field. In the past WSU had varsity programs of [[boxing]], [[collegiate wrestling|wrestling]], [[gymnastics]], and men's [[Swimming (sport)|swimming]]. In 1917, WSU won its first National Championship in Men's Basketball. In 1937, Roy Petragallo and Ed McKinnon won the NCAA boxing championship, another national championship. The Cougars third and most recent National Championship was earned in 1977 Indoor Track and Field.
